definition: complicated/many/in great numbers/abbr. for 繁體|繁体[fan2 ti3], traditional form of Chinese characters

sentences.english: I was busy but miserable at twenty.
sentences.chinese: 我的二十岁是繁忙并且痛苦的。

sentences.english: It’s no doubt that Black Friday will be busier this year than it ever has been.
sentences.chinese: 毋容置疑，今年的黑色星期五将会更为繁忙。

sentences.english: This busy pace accompanies lots of cash flow.
sentences.chinese: 这种繁忙的节奏意味着现金流转量很大。

sentences.english: STEVE EMBER: The gardens offer peace in the middle of a busy city.
sentences.chinese: 这个橡树园给繁忙的闹市带来一份平静。

sentences.english: Is life passing us by as we keep our minds super-busy?
sentences.chinese: 当我们让思想如此繁忙时，生活是否悄然而过？

sentences.english: The Atlanta and Portland transit systems are also recording heavy usage.
sentences.chinese: 亚特兰大和波特兰的运输系统也运务繁忙。

sentences.english: This is a very busy road, with approximately 8 lanes for a pedestrian to cross.
sentences.chinese: 该道路十分繁忙，行人过马路须穿越八个车道的道路。

sentences.english: The port is crowded with ships coming and going.
sentences.chinese: 港口一片繁忙景象，来往船只风樯林立。

sentences.english: The house is situated near a busy round-about with lots of noisy traffic.
sentences.chinese: 住宅靠近一个繁忙的环状交叉路口，交通噪音非常大。

sentences.english: Naivasha to Nairobi, Kenya's road is one of the busiest highways .
sentences.chinese: 奈瓦沙到内罗毕的公路是肯尼亚最繁忙的公路之一。

sentences.english: Resentments accumulated between these two busy professionals.
sentences.chinese: 这两位繁忙的职业者之间怨恨积累。
这几条路的交通很繁忙。

sentences.english: After stepping into the 21th century, our citizens' life became busier and busier.
sentences.chinese: 跨入21世纪后，市民的生活变得繁忙，忙了。

sentences.english: In this scenario, one connection is always busy.
sentences.chinese: 在这种情况下，一个连接始终是繁忙状态。

sentences.english: Look, the traffic jam is more heavy than here in rural.
sentences.chinese: 瞧，城市的路比农村的路更宽更繁忙。

sentences.english: Brokerage firm, said Hyun Bin and Song Hye Kyo very busy their work, relationships become more distant nature.
sentences.chinese: 工作都非常繁忙，关系自然变得比较疏远。

definition: lit. to continuously revolve/to work non-stop/to work around the clock (idiom)
to be busy rushing about/to bustle about
endless stream of horse and carriages (idiom)/heavy traffic
to rush about/to be constantly on the move
